body:
I also experienced this issue, with a similar setup:
- OS Platform and Distribution: Arch Linux
- MLflow installed from: official pip \ pypi
- MLflow version: 1.17.0
- MLflow backend store:MySQL 8.0.25 locally hosted via docker
- MLflow artifact root: local file system
- Python version: 3.9.5

I noticed that I only got a Deadlock error in `store.log_metric()` if the given metric key for a run_id is not yet in the latest_metrics table (so the first log of a new metric). 

I did some digging and was able to consistently reproduce this error:
1. Run MySQL via: `sudo docker run --name=mysql-mlflow -e MYSQL_DATABASE=mlflow -e MYSQL_USER=mlflow -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=mysecretpasswd -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=mysecretrootpasswd -d -p 3306:3306 mysql:8.0.25`
2. Install mlflow==1.17.0 (also tested with master branch at 198c07d7) and mysqlclient (in venv).
3. Running the following script:

```python
import threading
import logging
import time

import math
from mlflow.entities import Metric
from mlflow.store.tracking.dbmodels.models import SqlMetric, SqlLatestMetric
from mlflow.store.tracking.sqlalchemy_store import SqlAlchemyStore

# setup logger
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
ch = logging.StreamHandler()
formatter = logging.Formatter('%(asctime)s:TID-%(thread)d:%(levelname)s: %(message)s')
ch.setFormatter(formatter)
logger.addHandler(ch)
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)

# database configuration
db_uri = "mysql://mlflow:mysecretpasswd@127.0.0.1:3306/mlflow"
default_artifact_root = "./mlruns"
store = SqlAlchemyStore(db_uri, default_artifact_root)

# create 2 runs in 1 experiment
experiment_name = f'test_experiment_{math.floor(time.time()):.0f}'
experiment_id = store.create_experiment(name=experiment_name)
run1 = store.create_run(
    experiment_id=experiment_id,
    user_id="test_user",
    start_time=time.time(),
    tags={}
)
run2 = store.create_run(
    experiment_id=experiment_id,
    user_id="test_user",
    start_time=time.time(),
    tags={}
)

# we'll try to add metric1 to run1 and metric2 to run2 at the same time
i = math.floor(time.time())

metric1 = Metric(key=f"metric_run_{i}", value=0.1, timestamp=0, step=0)
metric2 = Metric(key=f"metric_run_{i}", value=0.2, timestamp=0, step=0)


def log_metric(run_id, metric):
    # Note: a minimal version of mlflow.store.tracking.sqlalchemy_store.SqlAlchemyStore.log_metric
    #       (without the validations)
    logger.info(f'starting run {run_id}')
    with store.ManagedSessionMaker() as session:
        logged_metric = SqlMetric(
            run_uuid=run_id,
            key=metric.key,
            value=metric.value,
            timestamp=metric.timestamp,
            step=metric.step,
            is_nan=False
        )
        session.add(logged_metric)
        latest_metric = (
            session.query(SqlLatestMetric)
                .filter(
                    SqlLatestMetric.run_uuid == logged_metric.run_uuid,
                    SqlLatestMetric.key == logged_metric.key,
                )
                .with_for_update()
                .one_or_none()
        )
        assert latest_metric is None
        logger.info("going to sleep ...")
        time.sleep(4)
        # latest_metric is None, so session.merge will perform an insert
        session.merge(
            SqlLatestMetric(
                run_uuid=logged_metric.run_uuid,
                key=logged_metric.key,
                value=logged_metric.value,
                timestamp=logged_metric.timestamp,
                step=logged_metric.step,
                is_nan=logged_metric.is_nan,
            )
        )
        logger.info("going to sleep ... a second time")
        time.sleep(4)
    logger.info(f"committed run {run_id}")


def log_metric_wrapper(run_id, metric):
    try:
        log_metric(run_id, metric)
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(e)


thread1 = threading.Thread(target=log_metric_wrapper, args=(run1.info.run_id, metric1))
thread2 = threading.Thread(target=log_metric_wrapper, args=(run2.info.run_id, metric2))
thread1.start()
thread2.start()
```

Which produces the following output:
```
2021-06-11 14:59:08,548:TID-140422853060160:INFO: starting run f15f21c006e9487f92d339bfb8fdf95d
2021-06-11 14:59:08,549:TID-140422844667456:INFO: starting run a3cbd2380d2f4d4b9d7a5416ef38bf6e
2021-06-11 14:59:08,556:TID-140422853060160:INFO: going to sleep ...
2021-06-11 14:59:08,559:TID-140422844667456:INFO: going to sleep ...
2021-06-11 14:59:12,566:TID-140422853060160:INFO: going to sleep ... a second time
2021-06-11 14:59:12,567:TID-140422844667456:INFO: going to sleep ... a second time
2021-06-11 14:59:16,577:TID-140422844667456:ERROR: (MySQLdb._exceptions.OperationalError) (1213, 'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: INSERT INTO latest_metrics (`key`, value, timestamp, step, is_nan, run_uuid) VALUES (%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s)]
[parameters: ('metric_run_1623416348', 0.2, 0, 0, 0, 'a3cbd2380d2f4d4b9d7a5416ef38bf6e')]
(Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/14/e3q8)
2021-06-11 14:59:16,578:TID-140422853060160:INFO: committed run f15f21c006e9487f92d339bfb8fdf95d
```

The purpose of .with_for_update() is as commented in the code to ensure transactional isolation by setting a row-level lock (using the sql directive FOR UPDATE). However, if none of the rows adheres to the filter condition (run_uuid, metric.key), the row-level lock will be set on a non-existent row. This can have some strange behaviours as mentioned in these references:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17068686/how-do-i-lock-on-an-innodb-row-that-doesnt-exist-yet
- https://fastmail.blog/advanced/mysql-lock-nonexistent-row/
- https://mysqlquicksand.wordpress.com/2019/12/20/select-for-update-on-non-existent-rows/

In our case, instead of performing row-locking, both FOR UPDATE statements probably lock the whole table and are both allowed to do so, creating a deadlock. Some more info on this deadlockfrom (`show engine innodb status;`):

```
------------------------
LATEST DETECTED DEADLOCK
------------------------
2021-06-11 12:59:16 140559797991168
*** (1) TRANSACTION:
TRANSACTION 2565, ACTIVE 8 sec inserting
mysql tables in use 1, locked 1
LOCK WAIT 6 lock struct(s), heap size 1136, 3 row lock(s), undo log entries 1
MySQL thread id 11, OS thread handle 140560127969024, query id 206 172.17.0.1 mlflow update
INSERT INTO latest_metrics (`key`, value, timestamp, step, is_nan, run_uuid) VALUES ('metric_run_1623416348', 0.1e0, 0, 0, 0, 'f15f21c006e9487f92d339bfb8fdf95d')

*** (1) HOLDS THE LOCK(S):
RECORD LOCKS space id 22 page no 4 n bits 72 index PRIMARY of table `mlflow`.`latest_metrics` trx id 2565 lock_mode X
Record lock, heap no 1 PHYSICAL RECORD: n_fields 1; compact format; info bits 0
 0: len 8; hex 73757072656d756d; asc supremum;;


*** (1) WAITING FOR THIS LOCK TO BE GRANTED:
RECORD LOCKS space id 22 page no 4 n bits 72 index PRIMARY of table `mlflow`.`latest_metrics` trx id 2565 lock_mode X insert intention waiting
Record lock, heap no 1 PHYSICAL RECORD: n_fields 1; compact format; info bits 0
 0: len 8; hex 73757072656d756d; asc supremum;;


*** (2) TRANSACTION:
TRANSACTION 2566, ACTIVE 8 sec inserting
mysql tables in use 1, locked 1
LOCK WAIT 6 lock struct(s), heap size 1136, 3 row lock(s), undo log entries 1
MySQL thread id 12, OS thread handle 140560126625536, query id 207 172.17.0.1 mlflow update
INSERT INTO latest_metrics (`key`, value, timestamp, step, is_nan, run_uuid) VALUES ('metric_run_1623416348', 0.2e0, 0, 0, 0, 'a3cbd2380d2f4d4b9d7a5416ef38bf6e')

*** (2) HOLDS THE LOCK(S):
RECORD LOCKS space id 22 page no 4 n bits 72 index PRIMARY of table `mlflow`.`latest_metrics` trx id 2566 lock_mode X
Record lock, heap no 1 PHYSICAL RECORD: n_fields 1; compact format; info bits 0
 0: len 8; hex 73757072656d756d; asc supremum;;


*** (2) WAITING FOR THIS LOCK TO BE GRANTED:
RECORD LOCKS space id 22 page no 4 n bits 72 index PRIMARY of table `mlflow`.`latest_metrics` trx id 2566 lock_mode X insert intention waiting
Record lock, heap no 1 PHYSICAL RECORD: n_fields 1; compact format; info bits 0
 0: len 8; hex 73757072656d756d; asc supremum;;

*** WE ROLL BACK TRANSACTION (2)
```

There are multiple options mentioned in the references for 'solving' this behavior, but I would need some input from maintainers on which one to choose.
@anjsam1402 Could you assign a triaging label (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_TRIAGE.rst), e.g. `help wanted` or `needs committer feedback` to get this issue back on the radar?
@harupy Could you help in getting this issue back on track?

rename.from: [BUG] Deadlock issue raised frombackend store DB
rename.to: [BUG] Deadlock issue raised from backend store DB

body:
Hi @anjsam1402 !
I'm quite new here so first of all: nice to meet you!

This looks interesting!
I'll take a look and see if I can help somehow.
Keep me posted if there are any updates!

@dbczumar I just noticed it's assigned to you.
Any update on this yet?
Hi @NieuweNils ! We've identified a similar issue and fixed it in the Databricks-hosted MLflow Tracking service. I'm going to apply a corresponding fix to OSS to close out this issue shortly!
Hi @dbczumar, did you have a chance to apply the deadlock fix for the OSS mlflow tracking service? We've been seeing this issue and would love to get it resolved :)
Addressed via #5460. Apologies for the delay!
